title: GEORADIUS returns the same key twice on Redis 3.1.999
body:
# The bug

A `GEORADIUS` query returns the same key twice. Since `GEORADIUS` [is defined as](http://redis.io/commands/georadius):

> Return the members of a sorted set populated with geospatial information...

I assume that having a duplicate in the set is an erroneous behaviour. 
# Steps to reproduce on `redis-cli`

```
127.0.0.1:6379[1]> GEOADD users -47.271613776683807 -54.534504198047678 user_000000
(integer) 1
127.0.0.1:6379[1]> GEOADD users -47.271613776683807 -54.534504198047678 user_000000
(integer) 0
127.0.0.1:6379[1]> GEORADIUS users 0 0 50000 km WITHCOORD
1) 1) "user_000000"
   2) 1) "-47.271613776683807"
      2) "-54.534504198047678"
2) 1) "user_000000"
   2) 1) "-47.271613776683807"
      2) "-54.534504198047678"
```
# Notes
## Adding the key multiple times

Adding the same key more than twice seems to add the key only twice:

```
127.0.0.1:6379[2]> GEOADD users -47.271613776683807 -54.534504198047678 user_000000
(integer) 1
127.0.0.1:6379[2]> GEOADD users -47.271613776683807 -54.534504198047678 user_000000
(integer) 0
127.0.0.1:6379[2]> GEOADD users -47.271613776683807 -54.534504198047678 user_000000
(integer) 0
127.0.0.1:6379[2]> GEOADD users -47.271613776683807 -54.534504198047678 user_000000
(integer) 0
127.0.0.1:6379[2]> GEORADIUS users 0 0 50000 km WITHCOORD
1) 1) "user_000000"
   2) 1) "-47.271613776683807"
      2) "-54.534504198047678"
2) 1) "user_000000"
   2) 1) "-47.271613776683807"
      2) "-54.534504198047678"
```
## Other coordinates

The bug was not reproduced with other coordinates, e.g.:

```
127.0.0.1:6379[2]> GEOADD users 10 10 'x'
(integer) 1
127.0.0.1:6379[2]> GEORADIUS users 10 10 500 km WITHCOORD
1) 1) "x"
   2) 1) "10.000002086162567"
      2) "10.00000092823273"
127.0.0.1:6379[2]> GEOADD users 10 10 'x'
(integer) 0
127.0.0.1:6379[2]> GEORADIUS users 10 10 500 km WITHCOORD
1) 1) "x"
   2) 1) "10.000002086162567"
      2) "10.00000092823273"
```
